questions.question_text: A packet has a destination address that is located outside of the local network. Which of the following should be used to route this packet out of the local network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. Default gateway, as it is responsible for routing packets that are addressed to destinations outside the local network.

Selected Answer: D
The default gateway is used to route packets that are destined for addresses outside the local network. It serves as the next-hop router that handles traffic leaving the local network. The other options—DNS server, load balancer, and DHCP server—serve different functions and are not responsible for routing packets to external networks.

Selected Answer: C
A proxy server is the most appropriate device for inspecting web content as it can handle all outgoing traffic to the internet, allowing for content filtering, monitoring, and inspection. The other options—VPN headend, router, and load balancer—serve different purposes: VPN headend manages VPN connections, router handles routing between networks, and load balancer distributes traffic across multiple servers.

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants all outgoing traffic to the internet to flow through a single device for web content inspection. Which of the following devices is the most appropriate?

An attack is redirecting traffic from network hosts by changing their assigned DNS server. None of the hosts have static IP addresses, and the rogue DNS server was assigned automatically during the hosts' lease renewal for the network configuration. Which of the following should be implemented to prevent this type of attack from occurring again?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
DHCP snooping is used to prevent unauthorized DHCP servers from assigning IP addresses and other configuration settings, such as DNS servers, to network hosts. By implementing DHCP snooping, you can protect against attacks where a rogue DHCP server provides malicious configuration information, such as a fake DNS server. The other options—port security, 802.1X authentication, and MAC filtering—address different types of security issues and do not specifically prevent unauthorized DHCP servers from affecting network configurations.

questions.question_text: The cybersecurity department needs to monitor historical IP network traffic on the WAN interface of the outside router without installing network sensors. Which of the following would be best to allow the department to complete this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
NetFlow provides detailed statistics on IP traffic, allowing for comprehensive monitoring and analysis of network flows. It captures data on network traffic, such as the source and destination IP addresses, ports, protocols, and volume of traffic.

Selected Answer: A
Network traffic is almost always NetFlow

Selected Answer: A
To monitor historical IP network traffic on the WAN interface of an outside router without installing network sensors, the best option is A. Enabling NetFlow on the interface.

Selected Answer: A
A. Enabling NetFlow on the interface

NetFlow is a network protocol developed by Cisco for collecting IP traffic information. By enabling NetFlow on the WAN interface of the router, the cybersecurity department can monitor and analyze historical IP network traffic without needing additional sensors. The other options—SSH, SNMP, and 802.1Q—serve different purposes: SSH is for secure remote access, SNMP is for network management and monitoring, and 802.1Q is used for VLAN tagging.

questions.question_text: A technician is installing multiple UPS units in a major retail store. The technician is required to keep track of all changes to new and old equipment. Which of the following will allow the technician to record these changes?

discussion.content:
CSMA/CA (Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance) is the protocol used in the IEEE 802.11 standard for wireless networks. It allows multiple devices to share the same wireless medium by listening before transmitting to avoid collisions.

Here's why the other options are incorrect:

CDMA (Code Division Multiple Access): While used in some cellular networks, it's not part of the 802.11 standard for Wi-Fi.
CSMA/CD (Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection): Used in Ethernet networks, but not suitable for wireless due to the hidden node problem (where a node cannot detect collisions from other nodes).
GSM (Global System for Mobile communications): A standard for mobile cellular networks, not Wi-Fi.

Selected Answer: A
a no brainer

Selected Answer: A
Asset tags keep track of the equipment for sure. I was looking for a change log or something but that's not an option.

comments.content: Asset tagging is the process of affixing tags or labels to assets to identify each one individually and track data from real-time location to maintenance history. These tags can be assigned to both fixed and moveable assets that are spread across multiple sites and warehouses.

It is asking for the best way to keep track of all changes made to technology for clients. I work at a helpdesk where we assign a asset tag to every device. This helps us to record and mark changes made to the specific device.
